column1: {{unnamed}}
{{disambig-more|Galadriel|[[Galadriel (disambiguation)]]}}
'''Galadriel's Song of Eldamar''' refers to a song about [[Eldamar]]
column2: sung by [[Galadriel]] in her [[Swan-ships|Swan-ship]] in [[Lothlórien]] for the [[Fellowship of the Ring]].<ref>{{FR|II8}}</ref>

column1: It runs thus:
<poem>''I sang of leaves
column3: and leaves of gold there grew:''

column1: ''Of wind I sang
''Beyond the Sun
column3: the foam was on the Sea

column1: ''And by the strand of [[Ilmarin]] there grew a golden Tree.''
''Beneath the stars of Ever-eve in Eldamar it shone
''In Eldamar beside the walls of Elven [[Tirion]].''
''There long the golden leaves have grown upon the branching years
''And here beyond the Sundering Seas now fall the Elven-tears.''
''O Lórien! The Winter comes
''The leaves are falling in the stream
''O Lórien! Too long I have dwelt upon this Hither Shore''
''And in a fading crown have twined the golden [[elanor]].''
''But if of ships I now should sing
column2: what ship would come to me

column1: ''What ship would bear me ever back across so wide a Sea?''</poem>
==Other versions of the legendarium==
The earliest version of the song was published in ''[[The Treason of Isengard]]''.<ref>{{TI|XIVviii}}
